DataElement.preferredDefinition: The version of the code system used to document patient interventions or procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The source from which something comes or issues; to take, obtain, or receive from a source._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._Executed and carried through to completion.

This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

Concepts.definition: The source from which something comes or issues; to take, obtain, or receive from a source.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created to support MU Data Elements for ONC

ValueDomain.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Code System Version Identifier
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection._a group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole._A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A proprietary medical nomenclature of the American Medical Association widely used to report medical procedures and services under public and private health insurance programs.: Following the third position in an ordering or series; coming next after the third and just before the fifth in position.: The form in which a text (especially a printed book) is published.

Concepts.definition: A proprietary medical nomenclature of the American Medical Association widely used to report medical procedures and services under public and private health insurance programs.
Following the third position in an ordering or series; coming next after the third and just before the fifth in position.
The form in which a text (especially a printed book) is published.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An international system of medical classification used for procedural coding.

Concepts.definition: An international system of medical classification used for procedural coding.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms United States Edition September Year Integer

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms United States Edition September Year Integer
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Published by the College of American Pathologists, the Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms is a combination of content of SNOMED Reference Terminology and READ codes.: A country in North America, between Canada and Mexico, bordering both the North Atlantic Ocean and the North Pacific Ocean.: The form in which a text (especially a printed book) is published.: The ninth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.: A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.

Concepts.longName: Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms
Concepts.definition: Published by the College of American Pathologists, the Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms is a combination of content of SNOMED Reference Terminology and READ codes.
A country in North America, between Canada and Mexico, bordering both the North Atlantic Ocean and the North Pacific Ocean.
The form in which a text (especially a printed book) is published.
The ninth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.

PermissibleValues.value: ADA Code on Dental Procedures and Nomenclature
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Code on Dental Procedures and Nomenclature, American Dental Association

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Code on Dental Procedures and Nomenclature, American Dental Association
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.: Any of the dental diagnostic, preventive, and restorative services provided to meet the needs of a patient.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A system of words used in a particular discipline.: The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something.: A professional association of dentists, committed to advancing the public's oral health, the ethical and scientific advancement of the field, and the professional advancement of its members.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
Any of the dental diagnostic, preventive, and restorative services provided to meet the needs of a patient.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A system of words used in a particular discipline.
The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something.
A professional association of dentists, committed to advancing the public's oral health, the ethical and scientific advancement of the field, and the professional advancement of its members.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Code System Version Identifier
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.:a group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
A group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
